questions.question: 4 out of 5 U.S. residents live in urban areas; this is important because:

choices.answer: Cities cannot compost so the food waste raises CO2 levels
Car use is high because bicycles can’t be used in a city
Highly developed cities create a "urban heat island effect"
Light pollution blinds humans

imageMetadata.resources: National Climate Assessment, Urban Section, ©Iwan Baan/Getty Images

questions.resources: National Climate Assessment, Urban Section, ©Iwan Baan/Getty Images

questions.question: Coastal cities are especially vulnerable to climate change because:

choices.answer: Erosion of their waterfronts threatens their residents
Sea level rise will effect them directly
All answer choices are accurate
Storm surge threatens their community

questions.question: One challenge cities face in relation to climate change is:

choices.answer: Dense housing slows air circulation causing "sizzle zones"
The number of pets in cities emits additional heat
The need for city street lights overheats the air
The infrastructure in many cities is old & failing

imageMetadata.resources:
Photo courtesy of Pexels.com
Author: Ingo Joseph
https://www.pexels.com/photo/people-crowd-walking-9816/

questions.resources:
Photo courtesy of Pexels.com

questions.question: The elderly in urban areas are vulnerable to climate change in all the following ways except:

choices.answer: They often live alone without anyone checking on them
They drink a lot of bottled water which will be limited
Generally, they are less physically able to handles extremes
They may not have adequate heat or cooling & can’t relocate

questions.question: The dynamic nature of cities is helpful in dealing with climate change because:

choices.answer: People just move away when things get difficult
Energy saving improvements can be charged to the next owner
The constant turn over means people forget how bad it is
Cities are constantly rebuilding & innovating

questions.question: Climate change can interrupt the electrical grid affecting all the following services except:

choices.answer: Water treatment & water supply
Building heating & cooling
Communications, like mobile phone towers & internet cable
Self contained solar powered lights

questions.question: One of the major contributions cities make toward the fight on climate change is:

choices.answer: Providing thrift stores on every corner for used clothing
Readily available public transportation, reducing emissions
People can take taxis everywhere
Tall buildings that capture more sunlight for solar

questions.question: When we consider climate impacts in rural areas, it is important to note:

choices.answer: They are important locations for wind energy
They provide beautiful landscape for outdoor recreation
They provide resources & services for much of the U.S
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: Some of the biggest climate change related challenges faced by rural communities include:

choices.answer: Higher poverty rates & limited economic diversity
Loss of electricity means people can’t play video games
A shortened growing season as the weather cools
Neighbors live far apart so they don't know each other

imageMetadata.resources:
Photo courtesy of USDA Agricultural Research Service: 
https://www.ers.usda.gov/topics/rural-economy-population/rural-poverty-well-being/

questions.resources:
Photo courtesy of USDA Agricultural Research Service: 
https://www.ers.usda.gov/topics/rural-economy-population/rural-poverty-well-being/

questions.question: Rural economies are severely threatened by climate change in all of the following ways except:

choices.answer: Crop and livestock loss from flooding & severe droughts
The shortening of the summer equinox will affect crops
Shifts in planting & harvesting times in farming areas
Large losses from fire & other weather related disasters

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of the NCA 2014: (Figure source: NOAA NCDC / CICS-NC). Chapter figure  14:3

questions.resources: Photo courtesy of the NCA 2014: (Figure source: NOAA NCDC / CICS-NC). Chapter figure  14:3

questions.question: Cities & rural communities face some of the same climate issues; these include:

choices.answer: Too many people with the same name slows emergency response
There are not enough celebrities focused on climate issues
The need to upgrade aging infrastructure
People can't identify the needed solutions so take no action

questions.question: All of the following are ways scientists study climate change impacts on where we live except:

choices.answer: Record human sweat production inside homes
U.S. Department of Agriculture studies on rural development
Study climate impacts on urban design & community resilience
Surveys & social science research

questions.question: Many large U.S. cities have been working on ways to deal with changes in climate by:

choices.answer: Educating, assessing, planning & implementing action plans
Building citywide sun shields
Stocking up on emergency candy
Setting limits on the number of new residents allowed
